item.title: Python for Zombies (Brazilian MOOC)
item.description:
Description

Python for Zombies: 5000 enrolled in the first Python Brazilian MOOC Python for Zombies is the first free MOOC to learn programming with Python in Brazil. Our first edition had near to 5000 "zombies". A spanish version is possible for next year. Additionally I have been taught programming in past five years at FATEC, a public university in Brazil, with decreasing rates of failure in the introduction to programming discipline. We have 100% class in labs, Coding Dojos to training and we use many funny examples to teach, like hacking Facebook friends photos. Besides the traditional university students we have, at FATEC, special classes for kids in a talent development program of the municipal government.
item.dc:creator: Fernando Masanori

item.title: import community
item.description:
Description

Palestrante: Fernando Masanori

Resumo: One of the biggest differences, in the Python community, in relation to other communities, is its effort to improve diversity. There is even a Diversity Statement at PSF: "We have created this diversity statement because we believe that a diverse Python community is stronger and more vibrant. A diverse community where people treat each other with respect has more potential contributors and more sources for ideas." I was fortunate enough to take part in nine PyCon's in ten different countries: Namibia, UK, Japan, Brazil, Italy, Argentina, Uruguay, Germany, Canada and Spain. Some were not national conferences, but were EuroPython or PyConUS. I always took note of experiences on how to improve diversity, that could be useful and replicable in my local community and would like to share at SciPyLA. There are other reports that I also would like to share, which are only beautiful stories of how Python reaches the most distant people and places you may never have imagined.

Materiais: * http://pt.slideshare.net/fmasanori/import-community-62142823
item.dc:creator: Fernando Masanori

item.title: Python for Zombies: 15.000 enrolled in the first Brazil...
item.description:
Summary

Experiences of how we spread the Python community in Brazil with a non english MOOC (Massive Open Online Course) to teach programming. Hacking basic modules and classes to obtain the "Answer to the Ultimate Question of Life, the Universe, and Everything". A funny way to teach programming.
item.dc:creator: Fernando Masanori
